National Talent Search Examination (NTSE.Description: The NTSE is a national-level scholarship program to identify and nurture talent among class 10 students.
National Talent Search Examination (NTSE.Eligibility Criteria: Open to Indian students studying in class 10 in recognized schools.

Stage 1.Type: Mental Ability Test (MAT) and Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT)
Stage 1.Pass Marks: Students must achieve the cutoff score determined by the respective state/UT authorities.
Stage 1.Selection: Top-scoring students from each state/UT qualify for Stage 2.

Stage 2.Type: Mental Ability Test (MAT) and Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT)
Stage 2.Pass Marks: Students must achieve the cutoff score set by the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT).
Stage 2.Scholarship: Selected students are awarded scholarships for higher education.

National Talent Search Examination (NTSE.Scholarship Amount: The scholarship amount varies by the level of education: Rs. 1,250 per month for class 11 and 12, and Rs. 2,000 per month for undergraduate and postgraduate studies.

Benefits.Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT): Evaluates subject-specific knowledge in mathematics, science, and social studies.
Benefits.Scholarship: Supports higher education and talent development.
